project.teaser: Along with the tourism industry, cultural and creative industries (CCIs) are most affected by the pandemic. All CCIs need systems or management tools to make them more resilient today. Thus, CULTURATI aims to build an inclusive cultural-educational ecosystem with visitor and...
project.objective: Along with the tourism industry, cultural and creative industries (CCIs) are most affected by the pandemic. All CCIs need systems or management tools to make them more resilient today. Thus, CULTURATI aims to build an inclusive cultural-educational ecosystem with visitor and capacity management by using digital solutions and cutting-edge technologies to (1) enhance and support collaboration between CCIs, and citizens to promote Europe’s culture, values, and interests, (2) increase accessibility, awareness, and understanding of cultural heritage and arts, (3) preserve cultural heritage by preventing deterioration due to overcrowding and sustain valuable resources (4) enhance the audience experience through customized games, and routes by optimizing the number of people on the venue or site-based CCIs, ensuring social distancing between them in case of a pandemic. CULTURATI is a global content platform that enables CCIs, creative professionals, and citizens to create content collectively for cultural heritage and arts across Europe. Consequently, CULTURATI curates content in its database and delivers customized information with the help of its algorithm. Therefore, the principal objective of the CULTURATI project is to design, develop, evaluate and validate mainstream technologies for its ecosystem utilizing the Internet of Things, cloud and mobile technologies, sensors (people counters), and Artificial Intelligence. Our user-centered design methodology situates user needs at the center by actively involving them in five pilot sites across Europe to validate CULTURATI, as well as increase engagement with broader audiences. Accordingly, our interdisciplinary consortium involves computer scientists, CCIs, academia from various disciplines, including social sciences, SMEs, public authorities, and non-profit community initiatives to focus on engaging citizens, and ensuring widespread communication and exploitation of CULTURATI in Europe and internationally.
project.title: CUSTOMIZED GAMES AND ROUTES FOR CULTURAL HERITAGE AND ARTS
project.keywords: IoT, AI, algorithm, optimization, global content platform, content curation, CCIs, customized games and routes, audience experience

article.title: New tech to preserve cultural industries

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CULTURATI (CUSTOMIZED GAMES AND ROUTES FOR CULTURAL HERITAGE AND ARTS)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: Along with the tourism industry, cultural and creative industries (CCIs) are most affected by the pandemic. All CCIs need systems or management tools to make them more resilient today. Thus, CULTURATI aims to build an inclusive culturaleducational ecosystem with visitor and...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: System Design and Specification
result.description: This deliverable is intended to be the reference document for the development of the system of CULTURATI. It centralizes the requirement13 that this module will satisfy and the decision processes that have led to these requirements. To remain useful, it is meant to be a live document, firstly released early in the project as a draft, and updated over the project’s course.

result.title: Data Source Identification, Data Requirements and Data Lake Design and Specification Report
result.description: Specification of the system's data sources, as well as the requirements for data collection and storage.

result.title: Project Handbook
result.description: Roadmap for project management and coordination, including planning, communication, and implementation to meet the project’s objectives on time and within budget

result.title: Quality and Risk Management Report
result.description: Plan for Quality Assurance and Risk Assessment including annual project risk assessments and relevant quality conforming processes.

result.title: Ethics Assessment Report
result.description: Plan for various ethical issues including research practices to ensure that all are in line with the European Code of Conduct for Research Integrity based upon the following principles: reliability, honesty, respect and accountability.

result.title: System Verification and Prototype v.1
result.description: Report concerning the installation, tuning, and enhancement activities carried out. With this report, the first version of the prototype will be delivered.

result.title: Third Party Systems Specification Report
result.description: Specification of third-party systems that our software is integrated with.

result.title: Implementation of the Service Platform and Delivery (Prototype v.1)
result.description: Minimum viable product for the Service Platform.

result.title: Installation Report
result.description: Report concerning the settings used and issues encountered during the site-specific system installation. For each setting, the rationale will be reported, and for each issue, the impact and suggestion will be provided. Immediate actions will be taken in case of high-impact issues.

result.title: National Events Report 1
result.description: This report will be prepared in collaboration with partners in WPs 2, 3, 4, and 5.

result.title: Content Report 1
result.description: Report regarding the content created in different categories and levels with their intended target groups. 2000 content in total between 10M and 12M by RMK and AG (KPI).

result.title: Training Report - Turkey
result.description: Report concerning the training and system usage including number of attendants and their feedback.

result.title: User Testing Report
result.description: Report presenting data and feedback collected from the users in two waives in 12M and 15M; 1600 surveys and 80 interviews (KPI).

result.title: Data Management Plan 1
result.description: Report concerning what data the project will generate, made accessible for verification and re-use and how data will be protected. During the project, it will be continuously updated.

result.title: UX, Real User Tests, and User Guidelines Specification Report
result.description: Specification of overall UX design of the system, user tests and user guidelines.

result.title: System Components Design and Specification Report
result.description: Specification of the system components like server, web, mobile client. The document will also describe the interfaces between components and overall design.

result.title: Project Website
result.description: The project website will be prepared and kept online starting from M1. The following domain name has already been taken as culturati.eu It will contain the developments, progress, public reports, links to public data etc.

result.title: Policy Brief 1
result.description: Three summary policy briefs will be prepared during the three stages of the project for providing evidence-based policy advice to link policy initiatives.

result.title: National Consortium/Network Report - Europe
result.description: Report concerning the main stakeholders and target groups to form a network to communicate and disseminate about CULTURATI in Italy, Finland and the UK. It includes coordination and dissemination meetings and events conducted with the consortium members and various stakeholders.

result.title: Training Handbook and Audio-Visuals
result.description: Written and audio-visuals to train the trainers.

result.title: National Consortium/Network Report - Turkey
result.description: Report concerning the main stakeholders and target groups to form a network to communicate and disseminate about CULTURATI.

result.title: Dissemination, Exploitation, Communication Plan and Strategy
result.description: The plan with stakeholder analysis and social media/media placement strategies.

result.title: System Architecture Design and Specification Report
result.description: Specification of a modular reference architecture, interfaces for the modules, and the data flow between them.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
